Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deviled eggs, ceviche
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana cheesecake

rj0rO6PRI1ElZt09DhSoEQ.text: The restaurant is at the first floor of hotel. I like their open kitchen. You can see how they make your dinner.  The lamb chop is delicious!  It's a little bit awkward, I forgot to take picture of lamb chop.

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States

k6541BYE5x6gcyLoZaQL8Q.text: Slowest service I've ever encountered at a restaurant on a weekday evening. Stood at the unattended hostess station for a while, waited for drinks a long time, waited to put in our food order for an even longer time. The place wasn't even busy, just a few other people who also seemed irritated and forgotten. When the food finally came out, we almost asked for to go boxes because we were tired of sitting there at that point. Then trying to get someone's attention so we could ask for the check was yet another battle. Seriously ridiculous. Food was fine, but the service was absolute crap.

XyKMjKCIedEAUzTqoJiVrA.text: Went here for a small Christmas dinner and what a hot mess this place was.  For awhile I thought we were on a prank TV show.  It took .5 hour just to get water.  Then another 15 to order and get drinks.  Things seemed to have picked up, since it took only 5 min to get out first course, but too much optimism I suspect, because it took .5 hour to get our salads...at this point we decided to get a little buzz going since we knew we were in it for the long haul  Champagne  please . We made the best of it.    Most patrons were annoyed and trying to be cool but just wanted their food.  Finally our main entree arrived!!  The prime rib was not what I was expecting but decent flavor. The potatoes au gratin were good but lukewarm at best.  The green beans were frozen maybe flash cooked...who knows...not worth $48.00 a plate!  The wait staff were stressed for sure, but nice, apologetic and patient.  We greatly appreciated this because it could have been a lot worse.  I hope and Match was only having a bad night and not a bad year.  Merry Christmas kids!  Thanks for the kindness

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I hate everyone too

DzEjlxxwzIleOfXWSZqhGg.text: Match is outstanding! Great, modern space with outstanding food & staff! I've attended several of their special events too including the Game of Thrones pairing dinner. Tremendous! Everyone was thrilled when the giant turkey legs were brought out! Drink pairings were right on point. Excited for my next experience!

g4ISxM6U2smWjskteDBErw.text: Monday night special. My husband had a margarita drink and a margarita pizza for $10. Pizza was delicious, we shared.  My first drink was $7 the second one (same) was much smaller and $11. Apparently HH went away but we were not informed.  Parking (valet??) Was quite a challenge as well in an empty lot at 5:30 pm??   3 stars for the pizza.

i0hFJ0emQUULYMrkkPV1pQ.text: I came in yesterday for lunch and was completely taken in by the ambience. I was greeted at the front by David, who later turned out to be my waiter or "curator" as he explained to me. He noticed my appreciation for the art and informed me of the gallery across the lounge , being as slow as it was he even offered a walking tour of some the art near by.   Being absolutely famished , I had to decline , he then led me to a warm open air dining room with a view of the nearby architecture. I proceeded to have one of the best meals , accompanied with the most friendly and down to earth service I have ever experienced. Really looking forward to going back and asking for David for sure.   This is not a hotel restaurant, this is a restaurant that happens to be attached to a hotel. Would give it 10 stars if I could.

QbpO585SvxWMfQn6IRysmw.text: Awesome food! The cocktails to start were very tasty. Then we had a variety of food that we shared. Everything was super yummy. Would definitely recommend the green beans and the fries! The arugula and endive salad was really good but I think I would order a second goat cheese sandwich since it was so good!  The over environment of the restaurant is modern with lots cool artwork!

c0PZW8v0iI9ZOmWzKeM63A.text: Nice lunch.  Quickly accommodated a party of 6.  Match Burger was tasty and juicy.  Others enjoyed the Chicken Thai bowl.  Great service and since the weather was perfect, the windows were open providing a great open air feeling.  Definitely a nice lunch spot.

StqAYZwoyZaM3Nna8GoV4g.text: Love this place! Here is the latest menu! I've been coming here for months and they do go through a lot of changes but it's definitely to keep up with the growing bars here in downtown. Even if you don't stay here the staff is welcoming and inviting the drinks are AMAZING and resort style and the pool has nice misters that keep you cool even if you're

5cQPsdn_H_EhdLWDh0tmDA.text: First time in... I noticed this spot when we ate across the street from there so wanted to go and check it out. Ambiance was amazing, it was Wednesday after work had lots of stuff to do on laptops, grabbed a drink sat by the window, the air from the inside mixed in with the air from the outside it was like the perfect feel. The place was empty, maybe because it was during the week but more room for us. Ordered a pizza, it was pretty big for one, you can share it It was a little over salted on one side but it was delicious. Loved the atmosphere and the waitress was sweet and took good care of us. I think she was lonely lol because she kept coming up to talk to us. 5 stars because I loved this new spot to chill at!!!

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You can see the kitchen in an open concept
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious Marco Pizza we ordered

O4vIwYGjK1o2QawTRED5EA.text: When this place first opened my boyfriend and I would frequent Match.  The food and service was on point.  Within the past year and half we noticed that the service has declined.  The food is still good however I don't feel the price they charge for their food matches up with the service we have been receiving.  Service has been slow (when it's not even busy), we have been ignored and the staff has been cold and our most recent interaction was a staff member cursing right in front of us.  We live in the neighborhood and want to support businesses downtown however when the service isn't delightful time and time again, that's when we need to find another place for food and drinks.

nATRzmL6aawsai3JU3tzKg.text: Simply awesome! Flavors, ambiance, service, waiter it all checked, and it was all cool by me and all of our party. I almost skipped on this restaurant because of the low star rating, but once I put a spoon of their mushroom soup in my mouth I became thankful and grateful I didn't. I went for restaurant week - $44 special per person. They shined. There were a lot of: "mmmmm" noises on our table. Presentation was impeccable and portions were great. Their macaroni and cheese though needs a lot of work. It was the one tasteless thing. Also, from the beginning I told our waiter I wanted the Pineapple upside cake, which was available when we got there. This cake was set to be the highlight of the night... I wanted that cake sooo badly.... I couldn't wait.... And then when the time arrives, our waiter simply says: " Sorry by now we run out of cake "! That was so sad... So sad. To this day, I still think of what could have been. Yea, I'm exaggerating a bit... But I just need my moment. Ok, I'm back. In general, I do recommend this place. Besides the glitch, our server was very accommodating and cool. By the way, parking is not hard at all. They happen to be next to a parking garage that is wide open, no fees, or tolls, which is very rare for downtown. So it's easy to give it a try. Make sure they save you a piece of that Pineapple cake though:(

vQMPdUxSov8p3q5fx3Ypqg.text: Really cool bar and lounge. Industrial vibe matches the FoundRE hotel upstairs. Great happy hour menu made the burger half price, $7 vs. $14 on regular dinner menu. Good burger too! Comes with soup, salad, or fries. The baked Brie was also tasty. Meatballs had good flavor. Draft beers were not working, so I had a bottled amber ale from California. Decent service, but we were a little out of their way on the patio. Next time I'll try something from the regular menu.

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger with soup
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meatballs
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hazelnut crusted baked Brie

6u2iIUNeQQ18TYvyw9T4YA.text: As a local, I'm always looking for fun and unique restaurants to try in town. I had been hearing about Match a lot lately so I decided to go for dinner. The vibe of the space was very cool. Our server was Ken, who was super friendly, very knowledgeable about the menu (I can be a picky eater ) and gave us great recommendations. He suggested the Roasted Peach Salad with salmon, and it was incredible! We will definitely be back again!

bAJqREx5nUs7rC8dU1Jx3w.text: I held a special event here or a corporate dinner.  The staff that organized the event were highly responsive, professional, and accommodating.  When we arrived, everything was set and ready to go.  Service was impeccable, and we loved the food.  My team had a great time and i will not hesitate to come back to the restaurant to dine, but also to host future events here.

Jux_WuzqmtrpQLARuj9Bwg.text: This is the bar/restaurant inside The Found.RE Hotel. A very luscious and trendy boutique hotel. It's just north of Roosevelt on Central. This place has seen some changes and it is Class A! I don't hand out too many 5 Stars but this place is a gem. I attended a special 5 Course Bourbon Dinner with two 5 Star Chefs who both knew Chef Alex Estratta. This included a tasting of Woodford Reserve Bourbons and 3 different whiskey mixed drinks served throughout the meal opening with a choice of an Old Fashioned or a Sour Cherry & Bourbon and a Cinnamon Whiskey Sour and finally a Bourbon Coffee. Chef Alex would come out before each course and describe the interplay between the ingredients and the bourbon. An incredible meal!

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful place, great Breakfast

cBj_AmdTzjIY96CYmAbeeA.text: Very nice bar and modern setup, but after that everything was pretty poor. Service, stop and start, waitor took one drink order at a time and /or brought one at a time, then the food service was a disaster. Half the food came out and then an hour later the rest, my pad thai was dry, cold and boring. No ingredients but some chicken on the side and cabbage on top. Most others had same comments. The place was near empty so not sure how the service and food was cold. They gave us a free appetizer card not sure if it was food delay or if this is norm. Don't go..

pYkYVHCbVjiswviMCSThcw.text: Swanky!!! Hella swanky!! Match is a really cool happy hour spot or date night even. The drinks were pretty good, I stuck with Margaritas. The rest of the party had wine. I don't remember much about the food but the samosas were pretty tasty ...  not as good as Samosas at a local Indian restaurant. Nonetheless ... grab your girls or your co-workers and head to Match one evening!!

cFA3GMkfDTYx1F4Vm_W3kQ.text: First of all, the atmosphere and style of the place are top-notch!  Service was excellent and super friendly.  This restaurant could easily be packed and be a new downtown favorite if it weren't for the menu.  The menu items just didn't seem appealing to me or they were missing a crucial ingredient.  There just weren't enough options.  My dinner date and I settled for the burger.  Sounded good on the menu, but it wasn't anything special.  I actually had to eat most of it with knife and fork because it fell apart because the bread of the bun just didn't hold up.  I didn't taste much of any special sauce.  I realize this is a hotel restaurant, but it could be so much more.  We didn't have a bad experience, but we won't be back.

PRwPEDSfHtbiPEW8zY9l4A.text: Amazing ambiance and staff! Always a good meal no matter what I've ordered. The manager DJ always comes over to check on me and see how my week is going. I had to create a Yelp page just to brag!! Love this place!

1jviGfqqOHVIEyYxoCe-GQ.text: My girlfriend and I decided to have dinner at match Saturday night prior going to the comedy show downtown. It turned out to be an incredibly good choice. The duck roll appetizers and vegetable skewers were oh so spectacular. We both ordered the salmon for a main course and it was even better than the appetizers. The wait staff was very prompt and attentive to our needs and wants. We will definitely be returning.

_U8KK0epIemmi9Higg3ecQ.text: Ok  I really love this place but am currently giving them a two because their current menu has fallen below their standards. Their happy hour is now non existent and the food quality has dramatically dropped. The Chicken Satay Skewers at $11 barely had chicken. I use to love their food here but the taste has dramatically fallen off.  The humus with grilled bread did not have enough bread to enjoy the humus and we were charged when we asked for more. In general the menu is just so less interesting than it was and has just fallen in value.  I love the atmosphere and the staff but if they don't get the menu right there is just too many alternatives for them to survive on our list of options.

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Better view with scale.
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Satay. Where&#39;s the chicken at $11?

RluFUDgcQbkzrjHQjw_U3A.text: What an incredible atmosphere. The local art adds an edgy and authentic vibe to the already hip design of the restaurant. The staff was fantastic, especially our server Sebastian who remembered each of our names. Oh, and the food was so good. Definitely order the duck spring rolls. Thank you Sebastian and the Match team!

4Ocg1gqWiJecTjTLSXFCiw.text: Found myself here on a Sunday morning around 10. Went for the Bloody Mary. Glad I did. Very flavorful & spicy but not too nuts with the heat. Bartender and host so friendly! I really liked them and the small talk exchange was pleasant & funny (especially since I'm not one for senseless small talk). Although the manager passed me by several times without so much as a hello. He could learn a thing or two from his much friendlier staff. Moving on... I can't wait to try their food because their menu looks amazing however this was a boozing only visit (hungover...don't judge). Apparently breakfast runs til 10:30, brunch begins at 11. Hmmm. What about the twilight zone from 10:30-11? I didn't ask but did wonder to myself. You know those "I just don't care" moments? That was one of them. I'm sure they'll feed you if you happen to wander in during that hallucinatory time. Bonus- $10.86 for 2 damn good Bloody Marys! I'll be back to this place and I definitely recommend based on my positive bar experience.

Q1aPm9STzD7s1X7pkJtDbA.text: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for our anniversary. We stopped by MATCH for happy hour before we went out to dinner. The server was very friendly. They have some very reasonable drink prices for happy hour and some nice appetizers and meal items on the menu as well. Great spot for happy hour if your downtown or staying at the hotel. We will definitely come back for happy hour and stay for dinner sometime. Great ambiance and atmosphere and very nice patio area for the Phoenix "winter".

1k8kw2O8Q0ICvgRDOtIe5w.text: Had brunch today at match there was a large group and yes I know it's hard to serve such a large group. But the eggs Benedict was ok the eggs were over done and they ran out of hollandaise sauce and did say anything before they served it. Felt the serves was ok but really need a third service person.

qyu7V0KJS0blin7FRxM4lg.text: Was really looking forward to having a cocktail here last night. Perfect night for strolling around during a really nice First Friday. Went to the bar at Match, sat right down in front of the bartender and waited. And waited. And waited. Detect a trend? We waited while he was two feet away from us making drinks for everyone but us. Now mind you, there were two other bartenders working as well. After ten minutes of being completely ignored, we left. Won't be back.

L8IoOiQJleu4tvE54KqK7g.text: Ahhhh I wanted to like this place!! Came here with a party of 4.   The decor and vibe is A+. Very hip and modern. Didnt even realize it was a hotel at first.   The menu looked amazing - had some great dishes that seemed really good.   I got the pizza and it was pretty tasteless. Sauce didnt kick any flavor and the crust was pretty bland as well. Really had to put some salt, pepper and olive oil to get some taste.   Everyone else's meals looked real good but lacked taste.   Service was pretty good cept they left our dishes in front of us and brought the check. Was extremely strange to try and sign the check around all the dishes.

OUrL8pGwxt193nXd2GZnIg.text: Had a great burger there with my colleague. Very nice ambiance with an outdoor patio and large open windows that open up fully to connect the outdoor with the inside. The air is very modern. This is for sure a a great place to go.

M8ql2HT0TUBdNQiXTmQIAQ.text: We came here for our Father's Day celebration.  It was terrific.  Very interesting concept in the building where you order everything - including cocktails - at the register and take a seat.  Loved the $5 mimosas and bloody mary's.  The husband and son got the Father's Day hash and said it was richly loaded with beef.  I went for the Hazelnut French Toast with vanilla butter and bourbon syrup.   Oh MY what a plate of deliciousness that was.  I snarfed ut before I had a chance to take a pic.  Amazing.  The son and hubby tried it and coveted it.  (The rest of the family were fine with their yummy breakfast burritos)  I had a couple of swell mimosas to wash down that french toast which I am already trying to figure out when I can go get again!

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hubby

dMQu2heea0DYN_K0zzFWSA.text: Get here before the the secret is out! Amazing food, sexy ambiance, excellent service, and great prices!  This art gallery and industrial style restaurants and bar is a real gem not to be missed!  The food is amazing and prepared with passion.  We had the opportunity to talk to the head chef himself, who perfected his skills in high-caliber competitive restaurants in San Francisco and Las Vegas, and it shows.  He chose to give up the highlife and spend more time with his family, which is how such excellent knowledge and passion for food ended up on our extremely reasonably priced plate.  Take advantage of this gem before everyone else discovers it!

PHyDg_Y7xDp3FJu19urHog.text: This review is for the drinks and atmosphere,  as we came after dinner elsewhere.   Love the decor,  really unique.  Menu had a nice selection.  I had their specialty negroni, which used a mango compari, I believe,  instead of the regular compari, making it yellow instead of the normal red.   Tasted like a regular negrino though,  but still good.  Love the glasses they serve the beer in as well.   Parking can be difficult,  so use their valet,  which is free for two hours.   Will be back to try food.

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Negroni

TKdyNJ6Qn8X7omwOsFLxOw.text: Drink menu was terrible, honestly who made the options. Waitress was trying to get a date/get with the manager on the floor more than she was interested in waitressing it seemed, he was trying to be professional but she was openly on the floor flirting, touching his arm his back so on... My dessert (pudding) was a brick (not cold) they tried to fix it same issue again. Food was very forgettable, salmon dip was essentially tuna salad with salmon, meatballs were half face of the sun hot half lukewarm. The bartender was a better server than the waitress and was nice and conversational when we came in, valets were great, manager did try to make it better and gave us a discount because of the 2 awful desserts and the waitress charging us incorrectly the first time she brought out our ticket. The bartender and on floor manager are the only reason they didn't get one star; they were both professional and personable and courteous. Also we were there late in the evening but they were still open for 2 more hours, the other waitress was already pulling everything off of the tables (candles, salt, etc) which made us feel rushed.

dgcO8ADvi8i4SwgQ7Wiz3g.text: Tried this place last night because I kept seeing it from my daily train commute into work. The place is beautiful and the noise level is great for talking.   I ordered La Tabla ($14) which is a fancy cheese plate. It was good without being excellent.   I also ordered an extremely fancy cocktail- Sailing Down the Nile which included North African Absinthe. It was wonderful and the presentation was stunning!  However, the price of $14 was hard to swallow!  Especially, since I found out that there are equally stunning Absinthe infused cocktails around Phoenix for half the price.  For dessert, I got the Valrhona Milk Chocolate Pot De Creme with Hazelnut whipped cream topping. Again, really good (just fancy chocolate pudding), but not worth the $10 price tag.  Big question: will I go back?  Probably not, even though it was a very interesting experience and I'm glad I tried it, but their prices are just too steep for what they offer.

m6ge2ifZmQ3iqWTc5wff9A.text: Server Amber was helpful and fast dealing with a big party. Never seen anything in Phoenix quite like the cocktail menu-- lots of fresh herbs and Greek alcohols. Since they're relatively new they seem pretty flexible if you try something that's not what you expect. The food menu seems a little more traditional, didn't get any but some friends did and it looked good.   There's also an art gallery on the other side of the lobby for something to do when you get lost looking for the bathroom.

6BfPucckCrkS2gKbo_6PCg.text: The food menu is very limitted.  While its very eclectic there is nothing that knocks your socks off. We had the Korean BBQ lettuce wraps and apple pancakes.  Both were alright.

V5fgvAzFuc0CW9tFn4jI-w.text: What would you expect from a wannabe upscale fancy place in a hotel.   How about a $50 breakfast for two. Bacon and eggs is literally 1 piece of bacon and a side of two pieces will cost you $6.   The appetizers tasted good, wings, samosas, and lobster bisque. The lobster bisque was a family recipe that tasted like a dirty, sweet soup with butter and lobster more than a lobster bisque.   And don't get me started on the funky beer and liquor selection. I get you want to be hip and different but you lost our business to Fez across the street which had better everything for less.   Service was good and friendly so I'll give them that, but not worth going back for.

wAqtZhFICC9yj2iAaZdHVw.text: Great Happy Hour - This will be our 'Go To' spot for meeting friends for Happy Hour when we are in downtown Phoenix.   The prices are great and the offerings are always delicious. . The cerviche, chicken, beet salad, and veggie plate were all devoured quickly.  However, I did find the cauliflower a bit too spicy. Gary, our server, was very attentive.  Match is part of the Re hotel which is decorated with local art. In addition to the permanent collection, the gallery setting changes frequently. Do take time to view and appreciate the art. Maybe, you will be tempted to buy a piece and support the local art community.   At the moment, restaurant guests can actually park in the rear. This will change once the weather cools down. Their Valet Parking is free - tips are always appreicated. Please don't use the adjacent Irish Cultural Center lot. As a member of the ICC, I know how frustrating that can be, especially on First Fridays when the crowds gather.

kwClgmcLYaJTKJ_73KuhNQ.text: I ordered a mimosa and a chorizo burrito for breakfast. FYI, this was 7:30am and no other customers were present. #1 Who the heck ruins a perfectly good chorizo and egg burrito by making it with a tomato basil tortilla wrap?! Like, gringo style to the MAXXX! Why? It was still okay, but cmon. Really? And the mimosa, very good, but no offering of a refill. I don't understand that concept. Do you understand how much money you just missed out on??! Overall it was alright. Nothing bad. Nothing great. To sum it up: A lot of opportunities missed.

P2vX37fkg2mozVvLdnd0xg.text: Let me begin by saying that it was really confusing finding parking in my opinion. When we discovered it was Valet only parking it by default because we had already parked in the valet parking area when the one valet guy told us we needed to go back to the front to be serviced. He informed us that parking was complementary for 2 hours which is great.   Our server was a young lady named Sara who was EXTREMELY nice and informative! As for the food, I ordered the Buffalo Cauliflower and deviled eggs as an appetizer. The cauliflower was AMAZING! The buffalo sauce gave me the illusion of an "airy" aka light chicken. The goat cheese gave it a nice flavor as well and I don't really like goat cheese! For the main entree we ordered the Coconut Rum Cream Salmon and my boyfriend had the Marco Pizza which he rated a 3 out of 5. I would give my Salmon a 3 out of 5 as well. The cream that was under the rice was flavorful but the salmon itself was very bland. Once I added salt and pepper it was a little more tolerable.   For drinks I had the Spicy Peach which was really good. The spice wasn't overwhelming and it was fairly light yet strong enough to give you a little warm feeling inside. My boyfriend had the Lumberyard Diamond Down Lager which tasted like a woodsy Michelob Ultra. So you'd do better getting a Michelob Ultra.

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Marco Pizza and Coconut Rum Cream Salmon
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fF2H--12e9MzJ9p6lS45aQ.text: The five stars is for the Jazz band.  It's in downtown not Scottsdale at MATCH . Look up web site. It's hard to find jazz much less good jazz in Phoenix or in the area. Great central location  they are off the light rail for those who dont want to drink and drive. MaTCH Disney  located at foundry hotel. Music amazing as the band very humble and inviting great date night or just a night to chill. They play every Friday.

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buisness card

-u2298pqo9zyG_Dr_NbmjA.text: I've wanted to stay at this hotel so when I saw this place pop up for restaurant week, I thought it would be a good chance to explore. I went with a group of 7. A few of us enjoyed the bar before the others arrived. They have a selection of happy hour items. The cauliflower is tops in my opinion. Would go back for this alone. The deviled eggs were good but nothing special. Same with the ceviche.   We were seated on the patio, which was great. The bar area is open air. Overall cool ambience.   Our salads and entree items were a mix of hit and miss. The ribs were delicious which was surprising for this style of venue. Mushroom soup was great but we were told we were getting tortilla soup, however, mushroom appeared. The salmon was cooked well but was quite bland. The beet salad was fresh but lacked character. I didn't try it but there were mixed reviews on the chicken Thai bowl. The pizza here is awesome. They ran out of the dessert we wanted - pineapple upside down cake, so I can't review it. Instead we had banana cheesecake and chocolate peanut butter cake. Both were just ok. The cocktails were good, but again, nothing too special.   I might try this place again for happy hour but, based on my first experience, wouldn't go too far out of my way. On a positive note, the service was great despite the soup delivery mix up/items they ran out of.

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana cheesecake
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza is legit. Get some.

cMkIhIxg8XjF--Lu6N4EqQ.text: They have their own parking lot right behind the restaurant, so you don't have to worry about parking. They are also near a light rail stop.   I ordered the "Bianca Pizza" ($12) which has whipped ricotta, mozzarella, gruyere, garlic, mushrooms, kale, artichoke hearts, topped with arugula. It was definitely an unconvential take on a white pizza, it felt like a cheese quiche.   The interior is nice, and through the hallways of the hotel (FOUND:RE Phoenix Hotel) it feels like an art gallery. So take a gallery walk afterwards. The restrooms are neat as well.

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Bianca Pizza, under all of that arugula is whipped ricotta, mozzarella, gruyere, garlic, mushrooms, kale, and artichoke hearts.

14TiT5wB0ZfsFx3MfPC2ow.text: Had a girls brunch on a Saturday afternoon, nice big space and fun decor and energy. Partially open kitchen and nice space between the tables, not too crammed.   I ordered the egg white omelette and added ham to my omelette, it had great flavor, a large portion and fresh fruit.  The camelized onions, spinach and mushrooms were cooked well, and not too much cheese in the omelette.  They were helpful in accomadating my gluten allergy.    My friends ordered, there was some confusion about orders, but management was very helpful and everything was cleared up. I respect how it was resolved.   They feature local artwork throughout the lobby and in the hallways leading to the restroom.   The restrooms are unisex and each bathroom has a it's own personal toilet and sink.  For Spring Training, they are offering a special, bring your spring g training ticket in and receive a percentage off of your meal!   Overall, had a good first experience and look forward to returning!

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Fried Chicken with sunny side eggs and fruit side
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Extra Crispy Bacon
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg white omelette, added ham and side of fruit

oA8IcotlyVVZTvqNI6i77w.text: Had a lovely date night dinner with the honey here. We started with cocktails which included their signature Match drink and a watermelon mule. Dinner was equally delicious! I had the spicy chicken no bun ( more bunny food please!) and my hot date has the chicken pad deconstructed pad Thai. Our server was very pleasant and came by to check on us during our meal, but allowed us to just enjoy our date night in a leisurely easy-going manner. The ambience here was really nice too! We sat in the patio seating outdoors with some fireplaces and surrounded by some sculptures and artwork. It is a really beautiful space and the food and service and drinks all Completed the look!

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Match signature cocktail

dYtyU_wuSXa2EwcNyRC5AA.text: Solid food- excellent drinks. They make a smoky drink with whisky (forgot the name) and it is our go to drink. We also like when they have live music. Staff is very friendly too!

YMoX-bh_ttyzjrgULbB41w.text: The Monday margarita special is the best value around.  $10 for a margarita pizza and a standard, rock size, sour mix Rita.  The wood fired, ~12" pizza was three meals.  Gary was friendly, informative and attentive.    These guys would get five stars if it weren't for Gary's grumpy coworker.  My mood was definitely effected by her loudly bitching about how us guys, enjoying happy hour & um... employing HER,  were ruining her life.  I watched her send out a drink that was only 1/3 full... she added two scoops of ice to make it look full    Go on Monday!  Make her quit so these guys get five

ORCwYlN-ze-GjsvYhv21Pw.text: Pretty good food.  I've had the burger, pizza (fig), chicken sandwich, pot pie, bolognese and farmer's market platter.  All legit.  You could do much worse.  My girl loves their hamburger (she says it's really juicy).

zCRyGYOQkAoydAilfcxI-g.text: A great and exciting find! For foodies and libations. Great happy hour selections. (The deviled eggs are amazing) great energy and vibe. Staff is friendly. We will be back.

tcB4Giqnqnf7CUo1DJCHFQ.text: We planned on a late brunch, but it turned out to be after lunch due to our friends being an hour and a half later than planned. The food came out quickly and was amazing! Service was great too! We will definitely be back!

-OIRrBghyGlupKGAkpRgOQ.text: Que came here on a rainy Saturday night trying to find somewhere to go on a date and Alex the bartender attended us and prepared the best drink. I can't remember everything it contained but it had champagne and strawberries plus another mixture.overall, we had a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3fp9fi3aR-pxd_668-aI6Q.text: The lounge is lovely especially with the wall of windows open. Bartenders were fun and friendly, the custom cocktails were interesting and tasty.   Buffalo cauliflower was amazing, completely filled my craving for wings. Throughly enjoyed the deviled eggs and the pizza was perfect, crispy crust and the perfect size.  We had the avocado toast for breakfast the next day, with a side of bacon. The avocado toast was perfect, just the right amount of balsamic and the poached eggs were cooked perfectly.

sWwVhbVPHJ6wfZsJ7cpFKQ.text: 2nd round and it was tasty. I ordered the Bianca pizza which was everything I wanted it to be. I thought it was a personal pizza but it was easily a shareable size! My dining partner and life partner ordered the Black Fig pizza. He very smartly ordered it with double the toppings and cheese. The wine was ok and the Sweet Heat margarita was perfect. But then when he ordered another it didn't taste the same. It was even a different color(?) Strange but satisfying

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OSKDcs4NbQFU9ZvLlpQnBA.text: Came here for brunch and thought my breakfast burrito was quite good.   When I walked in I totally forgot that I had been to an Elite event here some time ago! The restaurant was pretty empty on a Saturday (which surprised me because spring training was happening and people seemed to be coming in and out of the hotel). We sat inside but there's quite a bit of patio seating, which looked nice depending on the weather.  Like I said I ordered the breakfast burrito and really liked it! The thing that was interesting about it was that everything in it blended together. It had eggs, potato, cheese, chorizo & pico and you can basically taste everything in every bite. Also, because of this the chorizo & cheese weren't greasy. It was a LITTLE dry and our server brought us salsa that WAS SO TASTY. Even though I had ate half my burrito by the time he brought it I used the entire cup he brought me on the half I had left.   Our server was friendly and knew the menu. However, he did bring one of my friends the completely wrong order, but she was so hungry she didn't realize it until we pointed it out to her after she had a few bites. When we pointed it out to him he acknowledged it was his mistake and without even making a fuss he just offered to give us a percent off our bill.  I'd come back!

_Hha6EKw9zUlax7OjcNwpA.text: Match wasn't up to parr tonight.  Ordered the burger with blue cheese and a Caesar salad and bacon on the side.  Got a burger with no blue cheese and got the salad with blue cheese dressing.  Had two drinks and spent close to $30 with a tip for two drinks and no dinner-----didn't eat the burger nor salad-----it just doesn't feel right to drop $30 and not have anything to eat.

U5Dn9yj3b8ymZmDDsaAItQ.text: It's occasions like this particular Sunday that I am reminded of how lucky and blessed I am to have had the honor of raising the daughters that I have.  I don't often get together with the four of them. They're busy with their careers, their respective families, and they seem to be always traveling. Hmmm...I wonder where they got that habit from?   It was Father's day, and I didn't have much expectation as to all of us getting together for a sit down brunch or dinner. I figured I would either just get a card, email, text, IM, VM or any of the myriad of ways that one can get a hold of me without actually being there in person. Much to my surprise, my beloved daughters had scheduled brunch for all of us, along with one of my sons-in-law at a central location - literally on Central Avenue!   I surmised that since all the planets do align themselves once in a while, why can't I have brunch with four busy, successful, and beautiful globe-trotting millennials?  Match is located at the ground floor of the FOUND:RE Phoenix Hotel. I've never stayed here, but I was told that it is quite nice and accommodating.   Nice and accommodating is definitely a great descriptor of the Match's foyer / lobby, which it shares with the hotel. It's walls adorned with striking art, and comfortable couches throughout so that one can "lounge" around. It's a nice place to hang out for seemingly hours on end.  Their brunch menu doesn't have a large selection. However, what they did serve was quite appetizing. I should know this by now, but most of my daughters have similar taste as us. Therefore, in spite of my suggestions to order otherwise, we somehow managed to order similar items.  French toast with bananas. Poached eggs with breakfast potatoes. Sides of buttermilk pancakes. Our brunch was absolutely delightful. The portions weren't that large, but enough to satisfy our appetites. The atmosphere was subdued, yet airy. The background music was soothing, yet upbeat.   All of this lent to an amazingly wonderful experience catching up on all of their adventures. I often just kept quiet and listened. Inwardly, I was completely elated, knowing that in the midst of our many imperfections as a parents; we still managed to raise amazing young women whom we are so very proud of.  It was such a great Father's day!

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States

g-LRQOnuDNQaOYR3vShJTQ.text: Let's start with the positive, great space, outdoor seating & very trendy. A great place for a first date or to grab a drink before a game. It's right off the light rail, which is a plus.  Based on 3 visits 1 good and 2 could use improvement.   First happy hour before the game, bartender was little busy but more confused and disorganized, my sister order a chocolate martini, once we got her attention. Her drink came and was very good, I ordered a tequila on the rocks. You'd think that is simple but took about 5 minutes longer for her to pour. Please deliver drinks together especially when one is just a pour.  Friday night: bartenders was friendly, food was really good and atmosphere was on point. Not quite a party scene but a good crowd and a DJ. Great vibe just to chill.  Sat Breakfast SMH, ordered waffle, 30 minutes to come out, place was empty maybe 5-10 tables. Then it came out undercooked, bacon was nice and crispy.  Waiter came out and made a comment that they would make me a new one and not re-plate it, I'm guessing it's one of those things you say and wish you didn't.  I wouldn't do breakfast but evening crowd is a win.

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast margarita
Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum

llfuOKOo4OUkM1OV8TvRGw.text: Great restaurant. I traveled to Phoenix last week on business and went to Match for dinner one night and we hosted a reception the following night for a group of 40. I can't say it enough, Sebastian was fabulous! I saw him both nights and even though he wasn't in charge of our event the second night he still checked in with us throughout the night. There are a lot of great restaurants but it's the people who make them memorable. Thank you Sebastian, I hope he sees this! I was impressed at how he caught my name as I introduced myself to some of my clients and proceeded to address me by name the remainder of the night. Wonderful wonderful service.

-Srq1We9kuZwKvc7JX1r_w.text: Worst service ever!  I only gave it two stars because the art gallery within is amazing.  I give that five stars.  The bar-0 stars.    No one noticed us as we came in and around the bar to sit.  Minutes went by and after one of the bartenders helped the couple that came in after us, I finally asked the bar back for a drink menu.  A few more minutes went by and then bar back asked if we had been helped.  We hadn't so he called someone over to take our drink order.  This bartender was so slow, talking to one of the patrons while making our two drinks.  It was three or four minutes in between drinks and he served my husband first.  My drink isn't horrible, but tastes like a store bought mix of the drink I ordered.  I did see him make it, it's just not great.    At one point there were seven workers in and around the bar, it's not even busy and we didn't get helped.    This is slightly farther away than Old Town, now I know why we go there for drinks.  The drinks and service are impeccable on Old Town food r the same prices.    Don't waste your time at Match.

e48nbKXK6PzOcGWpP1YB3w.text: MATCH is on the bottom floor of the Found-RE Hotel on Central Ave in downtown Phoenix.  This is SO NOT what I think of for a hotel restaurant.  It's an art exhibit, urban, trendy, current.  Amazing and fun.  First, walk through the lobby.  Fun little plaques that represent the RE in the hotel name (i.e. the elevator is RE - lift, the door mat is RE-tread, the bathroom is RE-lief).  The floor, ceilings and walls all exhibit some type of art flair.    Then we entered MATCH.  Our maitre de/waiter, James,  greeted us by name and showed us to our table by the window.  He was friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, everything a good waiter needs to be.  I was swept away by my dinner.  Short ribs in a red wine sauce over puffy, yummy potato gnocchi.  It melted in my mouth and went perfect with my glass of wine.  Our entire party enjoyed their dinner.  My husband felt it was rather pricey but you do have the alternative of sitting at the bar for some less expensive fun choices.  And I thought my dinner was well worth the price.  I can't wait to go back again and would definitely ask for James.

7UGO9npglVNtvHFULhFZpg.text: Came here for restaurant week in the fall, and I found the atmosphere really cool. It's basically a restaurant attached to an art gallery, lots to look at.  As far as the food goes, I found the dishes well composed and delicious. They also had a solid cocktail menu, and a great beer/wine selection. I would definitely come back. Great place to for dinner with friends or a date!

-GKzRxYvEUfIzrGJPFiAtQ.text: Swanky and ... okay ... I guess.  I had the Spicy Calabrese pizza for lunch. The crust was crispy on the edges but "not so much" in the center. It wasn't soggy, but it could have been more consistent, and sadly the spicy pizza was not spicy.   The pizza had more flavor than your standard Little Caesars, but not by much.   It's "not bad" pizza.

8C1XKRPWEQ3TeAwDPwBmyQ.text: Good food, friendly service, and live jazz. Great brunch spot. Has both indoor and outdoor seating. Solid French toast, good turkey club. Mimosas.

3q9UUhi9OmmBqPziZn0HNQ.text: Spectacular lunch place. I had the salmon Greek salad, and the salmon was cooked perfectly. The salad itself was nuanced and flavorful. Paired with their Riesling made for a perfect lunch. My wife had the arugula and endive salad paired with a Sauvignon Blanc, which was also delicious. Both salads were tasty without being slathered with dressing, a common mistake made by second-rate kitchens. The service was A-one. The portions were on the money. We'll definitely be back.

QqYpbg24vWi_vSnkkC6FSg.text: I've been to match upwards of 5 times due to its proximity to my friend's apartment (can't beat across the street). We usually go for happy hour, which, to be honest, is nothing special. They have cocktails for 6.20$, but the menu is very limited and the drinks are fairly simple and not very tasty. The best of the bunch is essentially fruity soda with alcohol in it. Their play on the caiparinha is awful regardless of the fruit they put in it. On a recent trip, the husband wanted a beer and asked the bartender if beer was on happy hour....She said it was and it was 4$ but then after pouring and serving the beer she told us she thought maybe it was no longer on hh. She then charged us full price (6$). Not cool. So if you're a beer drinker, this is not your hh. I have tried a couple of their non hh cocktails and they were alright, but not worth their 13$ price tag. I tried the play on iced Vietnamese coffee, which is oddly green, and tastes decent but didnt blow me away, and their hot coffee drink with whiskey, which was super strong....The booze totally overpowered any other flavor. As far as food goes, I really like their hh hummus (which isn't hummus at all but a celery root puree). It's served with yummy pickled veggies and Noble bread.... That's worth ordering for sure. I tried the Jamaican patties and they were alright.   The best part of this bar is the atmosphere. The hotel is cool and has interesting article throughout. The bathrooms are awesome. If this place could revamp their hh menu to include a couple tasty, crowd pleasing drinks and stop worrying so much about the 'concept' of liquors from around the world, I think they could find more success.

0N6X9pWkeI3ChBPHo3V29Q.text: We went here for Easter Sunday to do the bottomless mimosas. It's $15 if you buy an entree as well. The mimosas kind of took a while to come out. Not very bottomless, but still not a bad deal. The windows swing out to make it more of like a patio style dining experience. The breakfast burrito is incredible! Decent service. The breakfast menu is priced well but the dinner is slightly overpriced. Very good food overall. Just docked for service.

1YXZ7BAdn5_rBMSNhdVOkw.text: I did a networking cocktail hour here so this will be limited. The fried cauliflower app was fabulous along with the humus and Nobel bread plate. I had a Moscow mule and it was wonderful and refreshing. I plan on giving the full menu a try next date night!

FMktWcBYyKaT-ZYYphjabw.text: I went here on a Monday night around 8pm alone and for it being not that busy the service was painfully slow. I had the Caesar salad and the crispy Seabass. The food was adequate, but nothing amazing for the price.The girl who ran the Caesar salad out basically threw it on the table and didn't ask me if I needed any pepper or salt which was also not on the table. My waiter was nowhere to be found so I got up to the bar and found a pepper shaker while bartender paid absolutely no mind. So if you're looking for somewhere with mediocre overpriced food and lackluster service this is the spot for you. The decor is very nice and if they managed to dim the lights on the patio a little bit it would've been very pleasant to sit outside on a nice night.

xi9D1MlX4eRFnoV1kEqBPg.text: Up until tonight, this place was maddening. When we first went, it was good, but not great. Then...almost inexplicably, it started to get worse. This was with a new chef, and we were stunned. How could a place that has these great ideas just fall flat? The kale salad was bitter and underprepared, and the short rib  was just...meh. On the other hand, breakfasts kept getting better. We just couldn't figure it out. Tonight, at a First Friday, we FINALLY got the whole package. Every dish was a delight (the hummus wonderful, the tiramisu nearly perfect, and the drinks were all flavorful and different). What really put us over the top was the service. Toby and Justin treated us like friends--with respect and a friendly face. Kudos to finally hitting the right notes. We'll be back very, very soon.

w-nkFWACcTFo6zbzq7NZ2Q.text: The brunch here is amazing!! Eggs Benedict were some of the best I've had. Also, their cocktail selection is on point!

ElXBRdOz1LI0LLCVqmSYDw.text: I feel really "meh" about this place... It was okay, but I definitely had higher expectations. We went last night at 6 for happy hour. It says on their website they have HH until 7, but they recently changed it to 6. They were accommodating and still have us HH prices, but I hate when places change policies and don't update their website. It feels awkward and cheap to ask for the deal. Anyways! I am a huge IPA fan and they had 2 decent ipas on their draft list. They were out of both (what?) so I ordered a bottle. Fine, I guess, but how can you not have any ipas on tap?? We ordered 2 appetizers- the vegetable skewers and the chicken wings. Both were mediocre. The patio is beautiful; has warmers and is really comfortable, but it was dead for a Friday night. I like a place with more of a buzz. The service was excellent, but besides that the place is nothing really special...

AfiwGoOGySsdA6faPMHCKw.text: My experience was so disappointing.  We chose this place because it's new and there were so many positive reviews. We met friends after work on a Friday. Even though the place was mostly empty, they saw fit push tables together to seat a table of  12 right next to us. The sun was going down and shining directly in the faces of half our group through large, unshaded windows.  I found it hard to believe a Phoenix restaurant would shade east facing windows! The food was pricey and the portions were small. Even though I consider myself somewhat of a foodie, I had to look up several words/ingredients to understand the menu.  My drink was delicious, Bloom's Negroni Bianco, but it was $11 and there's no happy hour pricing on this beverage.

MkVwfUZAo3qzFZhXLntXnQ.text: The food tastes amazing and the presentation is beautiful. I recommend the chicken sandwich it has apricot habanero sauce.

DYUyG0n86VhZayABbMqSQA.text: Located just in an artsy hotel, MATCH has some classic delicious dishes that left me happy, as well as a large bar and cool city atmosphere opening out to downtown Phoenix. Our trio had the flat iron steak, the lamb chops, and the seafood linguine, and none of them disappointed. The wait staff was very attentive as well. Have to try a lot of other restaurants at Portland on the Park, but this one stays on the list!

t78kMY9nHMDclQfPjCqIYw.text: Really small portions. The chicken adobo was extremely salty. The chicken itself was a small piece and was over cooked and dry. Nice atmosphere but restaurant needs work.

A7Isi4dfGppVws2r92sBcQ.text: MATCH. Serves. Brunch!! MATCH, newly opened this past October, is now serving brunch by popular demand, and just started this past January. I cruised in with my friends and was excited to try this night spot transformed into day spot.  The ambience of Match is still the same, it's trendy with colorful art littering the walls, and a sleek, simple but balanced, darker aesthetic complimented by big airy windows. It's not summer yet in Phoenix, so why not sit by the window? We definitely did. The brunch has a $27 deal that includes a bottle of champagne and OJ each- our waitress said it comes out to 5-6 drinks depending! Not bad for brunch! While we passed on this, we gladly ordered some Bloody Mary's made from their own special house mix and lattes by local Press Coffee. The fresh-pressed juices by Karma Juice also looked delicious, but many of them were sadly sold out when we were there. Overall, their beverage game was on point! Our server, Amy, was friendly and delightful, warning us that the quiches were so popular that there were only two left! Well, we obviously had to rescue them. So we ordered the last two "Don't Quiche Me on the Mouth" quiches and the Filipino Chile Relleno.  I am Filipino, and I always tell those who are not used to Filipino food, that the cuisine is an acquired taste. I was skeptical to try a childhood favorite with a twist- longanisa (Filipino breakfast sausage), but when I tried it, I think my childhood self yipped in joy! I would never ever have the guts to put a twist on a Filipino staple, especially because my mom would probably disown me if I did, and I have tasted many 'Filipino dishes with a twist' that have failed my taste test- but the dish had a spicy kick, and mixed with the cotija cheese, it was perfect. My best friend, who is also Filipino, took a bite and his eyes rolled in the back of his head! Safe to say- this dish is Filipino approved!  The quiches also tasted delicious were two inch high in thickness, stuffed with natural ingredients. Thumbelina could have lived in there and been good for life. By the time we were done with our entrees we were stuffed, but split the Oaxacan Wreckage for desert. When it came out, it looked so beautiful I didn't want to destroy it with my fork. The almond crumble was a perfect edition to the mole mousse. I will warn that this is not for the faint of heart or the diabetic- if you have a sweet tooth and are craving chocolate, this will definitely hit the spot.  All in all, I was impressed by the diverse menu. The Filipino Chile Relleno is creative and brings Filipino culture to Phoenix- something I can say I am very happy about, but it is not the only dish there exhibiting culinary creativity. The staff was also super amiable, and I can't wait to come back- day or night!

photos.caption: Photo of MATCH Restaurant & Lounge - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert menu!

9V5V763-CbvgnuAvnUHA5g.text: I love this restaurant and hotel and have stayed here several times since it opened two years ago. Unfortunately, the bar stock and offerings have been downgraded from fun and eclectic to mundane and boring. 5 out of 8 taps are dry, wine list slim and predictably passing in quality. Just not the right match anymore for the beautiful venue. I feel sorry for the bartenders.

w1DtZ98htYwW2HMHDlvBHg.text: Nice ambiance, pleasant server, Executive Chef Akos Szabo, has a winner for his lobster bisque, and pizza, gentlemen and a scholar, came out and introduced himself and  explained in detail, his ingredients and know how, fabulous food, fabulous chef.

Eka6AhH432NrrpCX-ksLnw.text: First visit to this spot. They have been open for 45 days or so. I wanted to love it, but I did not. We ordered a pizza and it was charred black across the bottom. That was all we could taste. I liked the fries but my buddy did not. They are huge individual fries. We also shared the pastrami sandwich. It was delicious but they were very stingy with the meat. If they doubled it I might still think they were stingy. The hotel is very cool. I'm not excited to return for food.

SFbJSVpQ_55J2NiguSAT2A.text: Came for lunch today and had a great dining experience! Ambiance and presentation of food was nice. We then took a tour of the hotel Found:Re. Worth exploring!!

lXX_TuYALbJ3jKAsajjChw.text: Got to experience Match for the December 1st Friday, and I can't wait until I go again! the meat ball and escargot were by far my favorite dishes of the evening! Staff was attentive, personable and gave educated recommendations.

bctm9RgpWlJstEW-QVNDYw.text: fantastic restaurant! awesome space and design, amazing food (try the scallops with short ribs and asparagus) and warm, welcoming, attentive service...thanks Amber! perfect place for a birthday dinner!

EQp-nW6OYVoW7n7gqyS8kA.text: Let me start off by saying the food was solidly ok. Everything else was not. The service was absolutely abysmal despite the restaurant being mostly empty.  70 dollars poorly spent on incorrect orders, zero water refills, and lackluster service. We will not be back.

wgHY3ds_ub0OTu7e32Lt0w.text: Overall, I think that perhaps Match just isn't best suited for larger groups, judging by the better reviews here. Food is alright, service is all over the place.   We had a reservation for a group of about 15. Mind you, this was on a Friday at 6pm, so it was understandably busy. We do company leader outings here and there, mostly in the Kierland area, and are not a group of picky people by any means, but this experience felt noteworthy.  Seating:  Half of our reserved area was the living room-style area, and the other half was a long dining table. Other walk in guests were sitting at our table for a good 45 minutes before we were able to sit there. We ended up squeezing all 15 or so of us in to the table, literally sitting hip to hip, since we planned to order dinner as well. Again, great environment for maybe a small group or a couple, but not the best for a larger get-together. Especially when you're trying to eat your dinner off a knee high coffee table. When you reserve, be specific about the area you need for your group.  Service: Our initial waitress was a very nice woman. The manager also greeted us to apologize for the table being used while our reservations signs were still up. However, another waitress came by to take our drink order roughly 40 minutes after getting the drink menu we had to ask for. She was very irritated with us and everyone else, and made no effort to hide it. Seeing as this was her first interaction with us, I'm not sure why she was so visibly irritated. It took over an hour to get water, which we all found very bizarre. When we told our initial waitress of the other waitress, she told us, and I quote, "Yeah, she's losing her sh*t." We began to joke that maybe this place had just recently opened?  Food: The food was decent. I'm no food critic by any means, but when you advertise "Korean BBQ Ribs" and bring out a salad with 4 medallion sized dry ribs, it leaves one to wonder what's going on. Our Divisional Vice President ordered wings thinking it was a safe bet. 3 seemingly undercooked wings came out. For $10? 3 wings? Luckily she's lighthearted and laughed it off. Someone else ordered a burger and asked if it was the AZ burger. The runner said "I'm not sure, this is my 3rd day." Fair enough - bless her heart. But the better answer would be "I'm not sure, let me double check for you." (It's the only burger on the menu, but neither of them knew that at the time.) The burger was ordered medium, but came out pink all the way to the outside. I ordered the Barrueta Pizza, but received the Spicy Calabrese Pizza. I was told this was what I ordered, so I shut up and ate it. It was actually delicious! I also enjoyed the Jamaican Beef Patties. We kept getting random orders of fries, which nobody should ever complain about. However, I will note that one batch was scalding hot while another was literally chilled.   Positives: Cool lobby with an interactive projection on the floor. Sweet picture of Tom Selleck? that cracked me up for most of the night. I'm a fan of the food I got, but felt bad for everyone else. Any-gender bathrooms were a very cool thing to see, despite the overflowed trash and lack of paper towels. Sorry Match :(

XP34JeP-czpgPIw4U_GFCA.text: I stayed at the hotel while on vacation with my father and the first night was great. Waiters were amazing!! The food was great and fresh but the second night we decide to sit at the bar and it was the worst! It wasn't even busy at all. We sat at the bar in hot Phoenix weather for 15mins without water or even a hi from the bartender. Worst service I've ever had at an empty bar. We made eye contact with the bartender with the cheapest ugly wig and she never even said "hello sorry I'll be with you soon" Ridiculous! Even after my father complained about the service she didn't even say I'm sorry. She just starred at him. She needs to be fired soon. The hotel is great but don't sit at the bar for a drink. Bad attitude that one. It's sad how one person can spoil the experience.

RATxjNN-exQPnlKOB8S0Lg.text: Food- good. Ambience - good. Service - be prepared to wait 15 minutes for anyone to just take your order and double that to see your food.  Even when it's a small crowd.  It seems like the bartenders just aren't that aware of people waiting.  Still worth trying, just don't go if you need something quick.

pPGDvSEcPWRH4_oa2D7xGA.text: We went for lunch. The atmosphere is great but service is terrible. Server didn't know much and she never bothered to come check on us when there were no other customers. I could see server prepping things in the bar area for later. Portions are ok size but we are not impressed. The menu does not specify any gluten free or vegan options, and when I asked server didn't know mThe drink menu looks good but we don't drink in the middle of the day. We'll have to return for drinks only. It's a new place and they have definitely not figured out things.

FyKIZJAxurkVD9GHcUaG5Q.text: I just had the Short Rib entre. It may have been the best I ever had. I will stay at this hotel again just to have the short ribs and drink a bottle of wine.  No need to venture out. Great views, rooms, and vibe.

_mntpkzUWuzdsoq2CAZPOg.text: They've  only been open just over a week and I have been there twice. My must haves so far are: the lobster bisque. Silky and rich with the softest most delicious gnocchi in it. Can't wait to go back and get just a side order of gnocchi now. Next is the green papaya salad. Simple and fresh but has tons of flavor. The third is the Bluto which is their chicken sandwich. Sounds ordinary...but it's totally not! They use dark meat which I'm happy about because I'm really not a big fan of chicken breast...so it's very moist. The breading is PERFECTLY crisp without being heavy or hard. And the sauce is sooooo good. I can't even really identify what's in it lol. I just know it's amazing. And the last item is the Escargot. I haven't been abroad...but my sister said it was better than any she had in France...so that's a good sign!  I can't wait to go back and try their breakfast menu
